static QStringList list_devices ()
 

Detailed Description

PropellerDevice provides an interface for connecting and managing a single Propeller device.

Definition at line 34 of file propellerdevice.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PropellerDevice::PropellerDevice ( QString  port,
int  reset_gpio = -1,
bool  useRtsReset = false,
QObject *  parent = 0 
)
Parameters
portA string representing the port (e.g. '/dev/ttyUSB0', '/./COM1').
reset_gpioEnable GPIO reset on the selected pin. The default value of -1 disables GPIO reset.
useRtsResetUse RTS for hardware reset instead of DTR; overridden by reset_gpio.

void PropellerDevice::requestPrint_color ( QString  text)
signal
void PropellerDevice::reset ( )

This function sends a reset to the connected device using whatever method is available.

Methods supported:

  • Serial
    • Data Terminal Ready (DTR)
    • Request To Send (RTS)
    • GPIO (Linux only)
  • Wireless
    • TBD
